Package org.neo4j.graphdb.traversal

Interface Evaluator

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PathEvaluator<STATE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Dijkstra.DijkstraEvaluator, DijkstraBidirectional.DijkstraBidirectionalEvaluator, Evaluator.AsPathEvaluator, MultiEvaluator, PathEvaluator.Adapter
    public interface Evaluator
    An Evaluator controls what's to be returned from a traversal and also how pruning is done. It looks at a Path and decides whether or not it should be included in the traversal result. It also decides whether the traverser should continue down that path or if it should be pruned so that the traverser won't continue down that path.
    See Also:
    Evaluation, Evaluators, TraversalDescription.evaluator(Evaluator)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Evaluator.AsPathEvaluator<STATE>
      Exposes an Evaluator as a PathEvaluator.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Evaluation evaluate​(Path path)
      Evaluates a Path and returns an Evaluation containing information about whether or not to include it in the traversal result, i.e return it from the Traverser.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        Evaluation evaluate​(Path path)
        Evaluates a Path and returns an Evaluation containing information about whether or not to include it in the traversal result, i.e return it from the Traverser. And also whether or not to continue traversing down that path or if it instead should be pruned so that the traverser won't continue down that branch represented by path.
        Parameters:
        path - the Path to evaluate.
        Returns:
        an Evaluation containing information about whether or not to return it from the Traverser and whether or not to continue down that path.
